intro: [WRONG START] Casia longipes, commonly known as the longipes casia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers. It is often found in forested areas and can thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Casia longipes is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
